definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: How about tidying up a bit in the sitting-room ?
sentences.chinese: 把起居室稍微打掃一下怎麼樣？

sentences.english: She came across a pile of old photographs while she was clearing the attic.
sentences.chinese: 她打掃閣樓時偶然發現了一沓舊照片。

sentences.english: He had to clean the chicken cotes every morning.
sentences.chinese: 他每天早晨得打掃雞棚。

sentences.english: They tidied out the kitchen yesterday.
They were hard at it with brooms and mops .
sentences.chinese: 他們忙着用掃帚和拖把打掃衛生。

sentences.english: 3 -- Do you often clean your room?
sentences.chinese: 你常常打掃你的房間嗎？

sentences.english: They cleaned up before they left.
sentences.chinese: 他們打掃乾淨後就走了。

sentences.english: Any lot noise away of you or you'll be scrubbing latrines that weekend!
sentences.chinese: 你們再要有一點聲音，這個週末你們就去打掃廁所。

sentences.english: I've hired an hourly worker to help me clean my kitchen once a week.
sentences.chinese: 我僱了一個小時工，每星期來幫我打掃一次廚房。

sentences.english: Now we have cleaned the room; we can move the things in .
sentences.chinese: 現在房子打掃好了，我們可以往裏搬東西了。

sentences.english: She helped clean and cook to pay for her stay.
sentences.chinese: 她靠幫忙打掃和做飯來支付她的留宿。

sentences.english: I went on a three-day cleaning binge before putting the house on the market.
sentences.chinese: 把房子放到市場上出售之前，我整整打掃了三天衛生。

sentences.english: Mr. Lopez was cleaning the store.
sentences.chinese: 羅培茲先生正在打掃店鋪。

sentences.english: And I was too tired to clean.
sentences.chinese: 我當時實在沒力氣打掃了。

sentences.english: Harry often clea his room as a tactic to avoid doing his homework.
sentences.chinese: 哈里常以打掃房間作爲逃避做作業的計策。

sentences.english: Thee trilobite can clean a room on its own, using sound waves to feel its way around.
sentences.chinese: 三葉蟲可以利用聲波探路，從而自己打掃房間。

definition: to sweep the floor/to reach rock bottom/to be at an all-time low
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
drawing room (room for arriving guests)/living room/CL:間|间[jian1]
to decorate/interior decoration/to fit up/to renovate
to fix a time/fixed time/timed (of explosive etc)
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
